main event: On November 1 at 33-22N 71-14W in the Atlantic, a ground-radar observation detected an unidentified object that moved toward the east at high speed, stopped and hovered briefly, then moved away at high speed.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 2 minutes 30 seconds.
The radar detected a single unidentified object.
The object moved at high speed and then hovered briefly before moving away.
The report mentions unusual radar detection, indicating an anomalous observation.
There were no photographs taken of the sighting.
